sentences.sContent: Listing 2 shows a sample algorithm which creates such a key by string concatenation.
sentences.sContent_eng: Listing 2 shows a sample algorithm which creates such a key by string concatenation.
sentences.sCn: 清单 2 显示了一个通过字符串串联创建此类键的示例算法。

sentences.sContent: He had a three-brush motor, with dynamic brake and intermittent on one speed only—his system was a concatenation of a lot of different ideas.
sentences.sContent_eng: He had a three-brush motor, with dynamic brake and intermittent on one speed only—his system was a concatenation of a lot of different ideas.
sentences.sCn: 迪肯说，“他有一个三刷马达，配有动态制动和以均速间歇——他的系统将不同想法综合串联在了一起。

sentences.sContent: The Arab revolt of 2011 belongs to a rare class of historical events: a concatenation of political upheavals, one detonating the other, across an entire region of the world.
sentences.sContent_eng: The Arab revolt of 2011 belongs to a rare class of historical events: a concatenation of political upheavals, one detonating the other, across an entire region of the world.
sentences.sCn: 2011年的阿拉伯起义属于一类罕见的历史事件：政治剧变的串联，这些动乱相互引爆，遍及一整个世界性的区域。

trans.tranOther: a series of events or things joined together one after another
